intro: Elegia bella, commonly known as the bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Elegia bella is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
